user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of UT_ClearDefaultReturnValue:
```c
void UT_ClearDefaultReturnValue(UT_EntryKey_t FuncKey)
{
    UT_StubTableEntry_t *StubPtr;

    StubPtr = UT_GetStubEntry(FuncKey, UT_ENTRYTYPE_RETVAL_CONFIG_CONSTANT);
    if (StubPtr != NULL)
    {
        UT_ClearStubEntry(StubPtr);
    }
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (StubPtr != NULL)
{
    UT_ClearStubEntry(StubPtr);
}
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: the if (StubPtr != NULL) guard makes the call conditional and both outcomes are potentially reachable, so there is no unreachable code in this fragment. (A violation would occur if prior logic or definitions made one branch impossible — for example, if UT_GetStubEntry were guaranteed to always return NULL or always non-NULL, making the if-body or the else path unreachable.)
